ground_truth: Alice, unexpectedly full of depth and truth in her role, begins to cry while performing her lines, stunning Charles, who watches in awe, feeling giddily transported. Joe, as he stares, becomes galvanised, realizing his interest in Alice has solidified, while Martin is taken aback by the passion and heart of her performance. During the heat of the moment, Alice looks at Charles, unsure, as he runs to her and takes her script pages. They prepare to film Alice with an approaching train in the background, as Charles puts on the headphones, and they start shooting. Joe glances back at the headlights and notices the distant vehicle turning onto the tracks, becoming unsettled. As the train passes them, Alice and Martin continue to yell their lines, and Charles is almost laughing at how good it looks, but Joe desperately looks back at the headlights. Joe swings the microphone down and yells, prompting everyone to run off. The train wheels' odd, dying chugs and screeches run out of momentum, accompanied by hisses of steam and the unnatural bending of steel. In the dust, Joe lies frightened on the ground with his eyes tightly shut, his mind racing and heart pounding, until he hears a loud metal bang. Joe quickly stands up and sees a mountain of twisted steel with upside-down train cars piled around him, realising he narrowly avoided being crushed. Hearing another metallic sound, Joe backs up, frightened by the labored groaning, whether mechanical or animal. As the crazy screeches and bangs continue, Joe grips his necklace locket tightly until a loud crash occurs, and a twisted ten-foot square train sliding door stabs the ground twenty feet away. Joe, stunned, turns to see the door and back to the noise's direction, but it's gone. Meanwhile, Charles' camera, on its side, finishes recording. Joe moves toward the camera, with Cary appearing behind him, smiling, having enjoyed the crash. As Joe whips around, he sees Alice standing in the dusty mess, shaken but alive. Joe beams, then suddenly realizes something and moves to the blood, reaching below the wheels as the others watch in horror. Joe pulls out his crushed makeup kit and brightens. They all move toward Preston, except for Cary, who heads off, to discover crates spilling from a nearby split car, many shattered, revealing thousands of small white-metal cubes littering the ground.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Alice, unexpectedly full of profundity and veracity in her part, starts to weep while enacting her dialogue, astounding Charles, who observes in wonder, feeling giddily transported. Joe, as he gazes, becomes electrified, realizing his fascination with Alice has cemented, while Martin is taken aback by the fervor and soul of her act. During the fervor of the instant, Alice glances at Charles, uncertain, as he dashes to her and takes her script pages. They prepare to film Alice with an approaching locomotive in the backdrop, as Charles puts on the headsets, and they commence shooting. Joe peers back at the headlights and notices the distant automobile turning onto the rails, becoming unsettled. As the train passes them, Alice and Martin continue to shout their lines, and Charles is almost laughing at how excellent it appears, but Joe frantically looks back at the headlights. Joe swings the microphone down and yells, prompting everyone to flee. The train wheels' peculiar, dying chugs and screeches run out of momentum, accompanied by hisses of steam and the unnatural bending of steel. In the dust, Joe lies terrified on the ground with his eyes tightly shut, his mind racing and heart pounding, until he hears a loud metallic bang. Joe quickly stands up and sees a mountain of twisted steel with overturned train cars piled around him, realizing he narrowly avoided being crushed. Hearing another metallic sound, Joe retreats, frightened by the labored groaning, whether mechanical or animal. As the wild screeches and bangs continue, Joe grips his necklace locket tightly until a loud crash occurs, and a twisted ten-foot square train sliding door stabs the ground twenty feet away. Joe, stunned, turns to see the door and back to the noise's direction, but it's vanished. Meanwhile, Charles' camera, on its side, finishes recording. Joe moves toward the camera, with Cary appearing behind him, smiling, having relished the crash. As Joe whips around, he sees Alice standing in the dusty chaos, shaken but alive. Joe beams, then suddenly realizes something and moves to the blood, reaching beneath the wheels as the others watch in horror. Joe pulls out his crushed makeup kit and brightens. They all move toward Preston, except for Cary, who heads off, to discover crates spilling from a nearby fractured car, many shattered, revealing thousands of small white-metal cubes littering the ground.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Unexpectedly full of depth and truth in her role, Alice is moved to tears while her lines are performed, stunning Charles, who is awed and feels giddily transported. As Joe stares, he becomes galvanized, realizing that his interest in Alice has solidified, while the passion and heart of her performance take Martin aback. During the heat of the moment, an unsure glance is given by Alice to Charles, who runs to her and takes her script pages. Alice is prepared to be filmed with an approaching train in the background, as Charles wears the headphones and starts the shooting. A glance is thrown by Joe back at the headlights, noticing the distant vehicle turning onto the tracks, which unsettles him. As the train passes, Alice and Martin continue yelling their lines, and Charles almost laughs at how good it looks, but desperate looks are given by Joe back at the headlights. The microphone is swung down and a yell is made by Joe, prompting a run by everyone. The train wheels' odd, dying chugs and screeches lose momentum, accompanied by steam hisses and the unnatural bending of steel. In the dust, Joe lies frightened on the ground with his eyes tightly shut, his mind racing and heart pounding, until a loud metal bang is heard by him. Quickly, Joe stands and sees a mountain of twisted steel with upside-down train cars piled around, realizing narrowly escaping being crushed. Hearing another metallic sound, a frightened retreat is made by Joe from the labored groaning, whether mechanical or animal. As the crazy screeches and bangs continue, Joe tightly grips his necklace locket until a loud crash occurs, and a twisted ten-foot square train sliding door stabs the ground twenty feet away. Stunned, Joe turns to see the door and then back to the noise's direction, but it is gone. Meanwhile, Charles' camera, having been on its side, finishes the recording. Joe moves toward the camera, with Cary appearing behind him, smiling, having enjoyed the crash. As Joe whips around, Alice is seen standing in the dusty mess, shaken but alive. Joe beams with happiness, then suddenly realizes something and moves toward the blood, reaching below the wheels as horror-struck onlookers watch. Joe brightens as he pulls out his crushed makeup kit. All of them move toward Preston, except for Cary, who heads off to discover crates spilling from a nearby split car, many shattered, revealing thousands of small white-metal cubes littering the ground.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Alice unexpectedly shows depth and truth in her role, bringing tears to her eyes. Charles watches in awe, feeling giddy, while Joe, galvanized, realizes his interest in her is solidified. Martin is struck by her passionate performance. In the heat of the moment, Alice looks uncertain at Charles, who runs to her and takes the script. They prepare to film Alice with an approaching train, as Charles dons headphones, and shooting starts. Joe looks back and notices a vehicle turning onto the tracks, becoming unsettled. As the train passes, Alice and Martin yell their lines, and Charles nearly laughs at how good it looks, but Joe desperately eyes the headlights. Joe swings the microphone down and yells, leading everyone to run. The train's dying chugs and screeches lose momentum, with steam hissing and steel bending. In the dust, Joe lies scared on the ground, mind racing, heart pounding, until a loud metal bang occurs. Joe stands, seeing twisted steel with train cars, realizing he narrowly avoided disaster. Hearing more metallic sounds, Joe backs up, frightened, gripping his locket tightly until a loud crash stabs the ground with a train door. Joe turns from the door to see it's gone. Charles' camera finishes recording. Joe moves toward it, with Cary smiling behind him, having enjoyed the crash. Joe whips around to see Alice, shaken but alive. He beams and then moves to the blood, reaching under the wheels as others watch in horror. Joe pulls out his crushed makeup kit and brightens. They all move to Preston, except Cary, who heads off. They find crates from a split car, many shattered, revealing thousands of small white-metal cubes littering the ground.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Alice, unexpectedly profound and genuine, begins crying during her performance, astonishing Charles. Joe realizes his feelings for Alice are solidified, while Martin is impressed by her passionate performance. Alice looks uncertainly at Charles, who runs to her, takes the script, and they prepare to film with an approaching train. Charles dons headphones as Joe notices a vehicle on the tracks, becoming alarmed. As the train passes, Alice and Martin shout lines while Charles marvels at the shot, and Joe urgently yells for everyone to run. Train wheels screech and crawl to a stop, with steam hissing and steel bending. Amidst the dust, Joe lies frightened, heart racing, until a loud metal bang jolts him up. He barely avoided being crushed, witnessing upside-down train cars. Frightened by more metallic groans, Joe grips his necklace until a crashing train door stabs the ground nearby. Stunned, Joe sees the door but the noise disappears. Meanwhile, Charles' camera finishes recording. Joe approaches the camera, Cary appears, smiling at the crash. Joe turns to see Alice alive amidst the mess. He beams, then notices something below the wheels. He retrieves his crushed makeup kit and beams. They head toward Preston, except Cary, discovering split car crates revealing thousands of small white-metal cubes.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
In a surprising display of depth and authenticity that takes everyone off guard, Alice finds herself overwhelmed with emotion and begins to cry while delivering her lines. This unexpected intensity leaves Charles utterly astonished as he observes her from the sidelines, feeling a sense of awe and an almost giddy sense of being transported by her performance. Meanwhile, Joe, watching closely, feels a surge of energy and clarity, as though an internal switch has flipped, making him fully aware and certain of his developing interest in Alice. On the other hand, Martin stands stunned, utterly captivated by the sheer passion and heartfelt nature of Alice's performance. As emotions run high, Alice's gaze meets Charles', conveying a sense of uncertainty. In response, he hurries over to her, taking hold of her script pages with the urgency of the moment clear. It is now time to film a dramatic scene with Alice, with the cinematic backdrop of an approaching train in the distance. Charles, ever the professional, dons his headphones, and with everything set, they begin shooting the scene in earnest. 

Joe, however, can't help but glance back at the headlights, noticing a vehicle turning onto the tracks, which unsettles him. Amid this tense atmosphere, as the train races past them, Alice and Martin continue shouting their lines, their voices carrying over the roar of the engine. Charles, completely immersed in the filming, almost bursts into laughter at how well the scene is unfolding. Yet, Joe, eyes glued to the headlights, feels a mounting sense of desperation. In a sudden, decisive motion, Joe swings the microphone down, shouting a warning that propels everyone into action, prompting them to flee. The train wheels produce an unsettling symphony of odd, dying chugs and screeches, gradually losing momentum. These sounds are interspersed with the hissing of steam and the unnatural bending of steel. Amidst the dust and chaos, Joe lies on the ground, frightened, eyes clenched shut, while his mind races and his heart pounds furiously. Then, a loud metallic bang jolts him to attention. Quickly springing to his feet, Joe is greeted by the sight of an immense heap of twisted steel and overturned train cars strewn about, realizing with a jolt that he narrowly escaped being crushed.

As another metallic sound reverberates around him, Joe backs away, apprehensive of the labored groaning, unsure whether it is mechanical or animal in origin. Even as the cacophony of screeches and bangs persists, Joe holds his necklace locket tightly, his grip a mixture of fear and resolve. Suddenly, a resounding crash echoes, and a large, twisted ten-foot square train sliding door spears the ground just twenty feet away. Joe, utterly stunned by the sight, turns to look at the door, then back towards the source of the noise, only to find that whatever made it has vanished. Meanwhile, the filming continues as Charles' camera, having fallen over, reaches the end of its recording. Seeing an opportunity, Joe makes his way toward the overturned camera. At that moment, Cary appears behind him, smiling broadly, clearly having enjoyed the spectacle of the crash. As Joe quickly turns around, he catches sight of Alice standing among the dusty wreckage, visibly shaken but thankfully, alive and well. A broad smile spreads across Joe's face, but it is short-lived as a sudden realization prompts him to move toward a pool of blood. With the others watching in horror, he reaches beneath the wheels and retrieves his crushed makeup kit, his expression brightening with relief.

Together, except for Cary who heads off alone, they move toward Preston, discovering crates spilling from a nearby split car. Many of these crates lie shattered, revealing a sea of thousands of small, white-metal cubes scattered across the ground, creating a bizarre and surreal scene around them.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
In an unexpected and surprising display of profound depth and genuine authenticity that takes everyone completely off guard, Alice finds herself suddenly overwhelmed with a tidal wave of emotion and begins to cry while delivering her lines. This unexpected and intense emotional display leaves Charles utterly and completely astonished as he stands watching her from the sidelines, feeling a deep sense of awe and an almost giddy sensation of being transported by the sheer power of her performance. Meanwhile, Joe, watching her closely, experiences a surge of energy and clarity, as though an internal switch has been flipped, making him fully aware and certain of his developing interest in Alice. On the other hand, Martin stands there in stunned silence, utterly captivated by the sheer passion and heartfelt nature of Alice's performance. As emotions run high and the atmosphere becomes charged, Alice’s gaze meets Charles’, conveying a palpable sense of uncertainty. In response, he quickly hurries over to her, taking hold of her script pages with the urgency of the moment clear in his actions. It is now time to film a dramatic scene with Alice, with the cinematic backdrop of an approaching train looming in the distance. Charles, ever the consummate professional, dons his headphones, and with everything set and ready, they begin shooting the scene in earnest.

Joe, however, cannot help but glance back at the oncoming headlights, noticing a vehicle turning onto the tracks, which unsettles him deeply. Amid this tense and charged atmosphere, as the train races past them with tremendous speed, Alice and Martin continue shouting their lines, their voices carrying over the deafening roar of the engine. Charles, completely immersed in the filming process, almost bursts into laughter at how well the scene is unfolding before him. Yet, Joe, eyes steadily glued to the headlights, feels a mounting and growing sense of desperation. In a sudden, decisive motion, Joe swings the microphone down, shouting a warning that propels everyone into frantic action, prompting them to flee in urgency. The train wheels produce an unsettling symphony of odd, dying chugs and screeches, gradually losing momentum. These sounds are interspersed with the loud hissing of steam and the unnatural bending of steel. Amidst the swirling dust and chaos, Joe lies on the ground, frightened, eyes clenched tightly shut, while his mind races and his heart pounds furiously in his chest. Then, a loud metallic bang jolts him back to attention. Quickly springing to his feet, Joe is greeted by the sight of an immense heap of twisted steel and overturned train cars strewn about, realizing with a sudden jolt that he narrowly escaped being crushed.

As another metallic sound reverberates ominously around him, Joe backs away cautiously, apprehensive of the labored groaning, unsure whether it is mechanical or animal in origin. Even as the cacophony of screeches and bangs persists relentlessly, Joe holds his necklace locket tightly, his grip a mixture of fear and resolute determination. Suddenly, a resounding crash echoes through the air, and a large, twisted ten-foot square train sliding door spears the ground just twenty feet away. Joe, utterly stunned by the sight before him, turns to look at the door, then looks back towards the source of the noise, only to find that whatever made it has vanished entirely. Meanwhile, the filming continues as Charles’ camera, having fallen over, reaches the end of its recording tape. Seeing this as an opportunity, Joe makes his way toward the overturned camera. At that moment, Cary appears behind him, smiling broadly, clearly having enjoyed the spectacle of the crash. As Joe quickly turns around, he catches sight of Alice standing among the dusty wreckage, visibly shaken but thankfully, alive and well. A broad smile spreads across Joe’s face, but it is short-lived as a sudden realization prompts him to move toward a pool of blood. With the others watching in growing horror, he reaches beneath the wheels and retrieves his crushed makeup kit, his expression brightening with immense relief.

Together, except for Cary who heads off alone, they begin to move toward Preston, discovering crates spilling out from a nearby split car. Many of these crates lie shattered, revealing a sea of thousands of small, white-metal cubes scattered across the ground, creating a strange and surreal scene around them.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Alice, unexpectedly full of depth and truth in her role, begins her performance with a subtle intensity that gradually deepens. Her eyes well up with tears, and as she delivers her lines, those tears spill over, creating a raw and genuine emotive display that captivates everyone present. Charles, who has been watching her intently, finds himself utterly stunned, his expression shifting to one of awe as he feels a light-headed sensation akin to being giddily transported to another world by her performance. Joe, observing Alice's stunning display of emotion, feels a sudden jolt, as if a switch has been flipped inside him, leading to a moment of clarity where he realizes his interest in Alice has grown firm and unyielding. Meanwhile, Martin stands nearby, his initial calm demeanor giving way to a sense of astonishment as he becomes acutely aware of the passion and heartfelt emotion Alice pours into her role. Amidst this intense moment, Alice, overwhelmed yet focused, turns her gaze toward Charles with an expression of uncertainty. Sensing her need for support, Charles quickly moves towards her, gently taking the script pages from her hands, signaling their readiness for the next step. With purposeful strides, they move to the location, preparing to film Alice against the dramatic backdrop of an approaching train. Charles methodically puts on the headphones, beginning to immerse himself in the technical aspects of the shoot, and gives the cue to start filming. Meanwhile, Joe, feeling a lingering tension, glances backward, his eyes tracking the distant vehicle that has turned ominously onto the tracks, causing his unease to grow. As the train roars by, Alice and Martin, immersed in their roles, continue shouting their lines, their voices melding with the clatter of the passing train. Charles is on the verge of laughter, caught up in the excitement of how visually impressive the scene has turned out, but Joe remains tense, continuously looking back at the vehicle’s headlights. Suddenly, Joe, almost instinctively, swings the microphone down and shouts out a warning, causing confusion but prompting everyone to abandon their positions and run for safety. The train wheels, emitting odd, dying chugs and screeches, gradually lose their momentum, filling the air with hissing steam and the unsettling sound of steel bending unnaturally. In the ensuing dust and chaos, Joe finds himself lying on the ground, paralyzed by fear with his eyes tightly shut. His mind races as his heart pounds violently in his chest until a loud metallic bang jolts him into opening his eyes. Rapidly assessing his situation, Joe scrambles to his feet, his eyes widening at the sight of a mountain of twisted steel and the topsy-turvy train cars that surround him, realizing with a shiver of fear how narrowly he avoided a fatal accident. Another metallic groan reaches his ears, prompting Joe to retreat cautiously, unnerved by the noise that seems to teeter on the edge of mechanical and animalistic. As the cacophony of screeches and bangs continues, Joe instinctively grasps his necklace locket, squeezing it tightly for comfort and grounding. A deafening crash follows, and he watches in shock as a massive, twisted ten-foot square train door slams into the ground a mere twenty feet away. As he stands there, stunned, Joe's eyes dart to the door, then back to the direction of the unsettling sounds, only to find the source of the noise has vanished. Meanwhile, Charles' camera, having toppled onto its side during the chaos, quietly completes its recording. Joe, driven by an innate sense of urgency, approaches the toppled camera, and out of the corner of his eye, he notices Cary approaching him, a grin spread across Cary’s face as he seems to have found the crash thrilling. Joe quickly turns around, and his eyes lock onto Alice, who stands amid the dusty debris, visibly shaken but thankfully unharmed. Feeling a surge of relief and joy, Joe beams at her, but a new realization hits him, and he pivots abruptly, heading towards a spot marked with blood. Reaching beneath the train's wheels, he retrieves his crushed makeup kit, a small but personal victory, and his face lights up with relief. The group, feeling a mixture of emotions, collectively moves towards Preston, save for Cary, who ventures off on his own. They converge around the site of a nearby split open car, observing in awe and disbelief as crates spill out, many having shattered, revealing a sea of thousands of small, white-metal cubes scattered across the ground.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Alice delivers a performance filled with unexpected depth and emotion, moving Charles and captivating Joe, who realizes his attraction to her. Martin is equally impressed by her passion. In the midst of this intense moment, Charles reassures Alice, taking her script as they prepare to film with an approaching train in the background. As they begin shooting, Joe is distracted by distant headlights turning onto the tracks and grows anxious. Amidst the passing train, Alice and Martin continue their lines while Charles is amused by how well it's going. Joe, however, becomes alarmed, swings the microphone down, and yells for everyone to run. The train derails with a cacophony of dying mechanical sounds and steam hissing as Joe finds himself on the ground, narrowly escaping danger. He stands, witnessing the chaotic wreckage of twisted steel and overturned train cars, realizing his fortune. Startled by more metallic noises, Joe clutches his necklace for comfort as a massive train door crashes nearby. Regaining composure, Joe notices the wreck is gone and moves toward Charles' fallen camera, which has captured the entire incident. Cary appears, entertained by the spectacle, and as Joe turns, he sees Alice unharmed amidst the debris. Relieved, Joe retrieves his crushed makeup kit from under the wheels, finding solace in small victories. The group, except for Cary, gathers near Preston to find crates from the split car scattered, revealing thousands of small white-metal cubes covering the ground.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Alice, unexpectedly full of depth and truth in her role during a community theater rehearsal, begins to cry while performing her lines, stunning Charles, who, having studied theater in college, watches in awe, feeling giddily transported. Joe, as he stares, becomes galvanized, realizing his interest in Alice has solidified, while Martin, who had always been skeptical of amateur productions, is taken aback by the passion and heart of her performance. During the heat of the moment, Alice looks at Charles, unsure, as he, demonstrating his impulsive nature, runs to her and takes her script pages. They prepare to film Alice with an approaching train in the background, as Charles puts on the headphones used to monitor sound quality, and they start shooting. Joe glances back at the headlights of a vintage car, a relic from the 1960s, and notices the distant vehicle turning onto the tracks, becoming unsettled. As the train, on its daily route through the industrial part of town, passes them, Alice and Martin continue to yell their lines, and Charles is almost laughing at how good it looks, but Joe desperately looks back at the headlights. Joe swings the microphone down and yells, prompting everyone to run off. The train wheels' odd, dying chugs and screeches run out of momentum, accompanied by hisses of steam typical of older locomotives and the unnatural bending of steel. In the dust, Joe lies frightened on the ground with his eyes tightly shut, his mind racing and heart pounding, until he hears a loud metal bang reminiscent of industrial machinery. Joe quickly stands up and sees a mountain of twisted steel with upside-down train cars piled around him, realizing he narrowly avoided being crushed by the derailment. Hearing another metallic sound, Joe backs up, frightened by the labored groaning, whether mechanical or animal. As the crazy screeches and bangs continue, Joe grips his necklace locket tightly, a sentimental gift from his grandmother, until a loud crash occurs, and a twisted ten-foot square train sliding door stabs the ground twenty feet away, kicking up dust. Joe, stunned, turns to see the door and back to the noise's direction, but it's gone, leaving a tense silence. Meanwhile, Charles' camera, an old Super 8 model favored by indie filmmakers, on its side, finishes recording. Joe moves toward the camera, with Cary, known for his mischievous love of chaos, appearing behind him, smiling, having enjoyed the crash. As Joe whips around, he sees Alice standing in the dusty mess, shaken but alive. Joe beams, then suddenly realizes something and moves to the blood, reaching below the wheels as the others watch in horror. Joe pulls out his crushed makeup kit, a personal possession he always carried for emergency touch-ups, and brightens. They all move toward Preston, the group’s unofficial leader known for his resourcefulness, except for Cary, who heads off to discover crates spilling from a nearby split car, many shattered, revealing thousands of small white-metal cubes littering the ground, likely alien in origin due to their unusual material.

Joe stunned turns to see the door and back to the noise's direction but it is gone. Meanwhile Charles' camera on its side finishes recording. Joe moves toward the camera with Cary appearing behind him smiling having enjoyed the crash. As Joe whips around he sees Alice standing in the dusty mess shaken but alive. Joe beams then suddenly realizes something and moves to the blood reaching below the wheels as the others watch in horror. Joe pulls out his crushed makeup kit and brightens. They all move toward Preston except for Cary who heads off to discover crates spilling from a nearby split car many shattered revealing thousands of small whitemetal cubes littering the ground.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Daisy, surprisingly brimming with mischief and adventure in her part, starts to dance while delivering her speech, surprising Leo, who observes with intrigue, feeling humorously lifted. Max, as he listens, becomes intrigued, understanding his fascination with Daisy has strengthened, while Oliver is startled by the creativity and style of her act. During the chaos of the scene, Daisy glances at Leo, uncertain, as he strolls to her and grabs her cue cards. They prepare to record Daisy with an approaching parade in the distance, as Leo puts on the sunglasses, and they commence filming. Max peeks at the streetlamps and spots the shadowy bicycle turning toward the road, feeling anxious. As the parade moves past them, Daisy and Oliver continue to whisper their dialogue, and Leo is nearly giggling at how impressive it appears, but Max anxiously glances at the streetlamps. Max throws the boombox down and whispers, urging everyone to rush away. The parade wheels' strange, slowing hums and squeals lose energy, coupled with smokes of mist and the bizarre twisting of vines. In the breeze, Max lies terrified on the lawn with his eyes tightly shut, his imagination racing and pulse racing, until he hears a deep wood snap. Max quickly stands up and sees a hill of bent wood with overturned floats scattered around him, understanding he barely escaped being trapped. Hearing another echoing sound, Max retreats, alarmed by the strained moaning, whether mechanical or bestial. As the wild hums and thumps persist, Max clutches his bracelet charm tightly until a thunderous crash happens, and a warped ten-foot square parade float door slams into the dirt twenty feet away. Max, bewildered, turns to notice the door and back to the clamor's origin, but it's vanished. Meanwhile, Leo's tripod, on its edge, finishes capturing. Max moves toward the tripod, with Carol appearing behind him, grinning, having enjoyed the impact. As Max spins around, he spots Daisy standing in the scattered chaos, rattled but safe. Max grins, then suddenly realizes something and moves to the puddle, reaching below the vines as the others watch in dread. Max pulls out his smashed sketchbook and brightens. They all move toward Felix, except for Carol, who wanders elsewhere, to find barrels spilling from a nearby fractured float, many cracked, uncovering thousands of tiny copper spheres scattering the ground.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Alice delivers a powerful performance, moving Charles and galvanizing Joe's interest in her. As they prepare to film near a train, Joe notices a vehicle on the tracks. Panic ensues as a crash occurs, with Alice and Martin continuing their lines. Joe yells, warning everyone to flee. After the crash, Joe narrowly escapes being crushed by the wreckage. Startled by noises, he holds his locket tightly as a train door crashes nearby. The chaos concludes with Charles’ camera still recording, and Joe, relieved to find Alice safe, retrieves his crushed makeup kit. They all head toward Preston while noticing spilled crates with small white-metal cubes scattered on the ground.
